12:"$Sreact.suspense"
2:Te53,{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Recipe","name":"Argentine Alfajores","description":"Delicate cornstarch sandwich cookies filled with thick dulce de leche and rolled in coconut. The ultimate Argentine sweet treat.","image":"https://expatsargentina.com/images/recipes/alfajores.webp","author":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Expats Argentina"},"datePublished":"2025-01-01","prepTime":"PT30M","cookTime":"PT15M","totalTime":"PT45M","recipeYield":"24 servings","recipeCategory":"dessert","recipeCuisine":"Argentine","keywords":"alfajores recipe, argentine alfajores, dulce de leche cookies, cornstarch alfajores, authentic alfajores","nutrition":{"@type":"NutritionInformation","calories":"180 calories","proteinContent":"2g","carbohydrateContent":"26g","fatContent":"8g"},"recipeIngredient":["For the cookies: 2 cups (250g) cornstarch (maicena)","For the cookies: 1 cup (125g) all-purpose flour","For the cookies: 1 tsp baking powder","For the cookies: 1/2 tsp baking soda","For the cookies: 200g (7 oz) unsalted butter, softened","For the cookies: 3/4 cup (150g) sugar","For the cookies: 3 egg yolks","For the cookies: 1 tsp vanilla extract","For the cookies: Zest of 1 lemon (optional but traditional)","For the cookies: 1-2 tbsp milk (if needed)","For assembly: 400g (14 oz) dulce de leche (Havanna or Cachafaz recommended)","For assembly: 1 cup shredded unsweetened coconut","For assembly: Powdered sugar for dusting (optional)"],"recipeInstructions":[{"@type":"HowToStep","position":1,"text":"Sift together cornstarch, flour, baking powder, and baking soda. Set aside."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":2,"text":"In a large bowl, cream softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy—about 3 minutes with electric mixer."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":3,"text":"Add egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each. Mix in vanilla and lemon zest."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":4,"text":"Gradually add dry ingredients to butter mixture. Mix until a soft dough forms. It will be delicate—don't overmix."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":5,"text":"If dough seems too crumbly, add 1-2 tbsp milk. It should hold together when pressed."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":6,"text":"Divide dough in half, flatten into disks, wrap in plastic, and refrigerate for 30 minutes."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":7,"text":"Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line baking sheets with parchment."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":8,"text":"Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface to 1/4 inch thickness. The dough is fragile—work gently."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":9,"text":"Cut into 2-inch rounds using a cookie cutter or glass. Re-roll scraps once."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":10,"text":"Place cookies 1 inch apart on prepared sheets. They spread very little."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":11,"text":"Bake for 10-12 minutes until set but not browned. The bottoms should be just golden."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":12,"text":"Cool on sheets for 5 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":13,"text":"Match cookies into pairs by size. Spread a generous layer of dulce de leche on one cookie of each pair."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":14,"text":"Sandwich with matching cookie, pressing gently so dulce de leche spreads to edges."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":15,"text":"Roll edges in shredded coconut to coat the exposed dulce de leche."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":16,"text":"Dust tops with powdered sugar if desired."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":17,"text":"Let rest for at least 1 hour before serving—this allows the cookies to soften from the dulce de leche."}]}0:{"buildId":"XJ7f5RvYDcX4yjbAXmNYG","rsc":["$","$1","c",{"children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"min-h-screen bg-gradient-to-b from-orange-50 to-white","children":[["$","script",null,{"type":"application/ld+json","dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"$2"}}],"$L3","$L4","$L5","$L6"]}],null,"$L7"]}],"loading":null,"isPartial":false}
3:["$","div",null,{"className":"border-b bg-white/80 backdrop-blur-sm sticky top-0 z-40 print:hidden","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-5xl mx-auto px-4 py-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-center justify-between","children":["$","$L8",null,{"href":"/food/recipes","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-arrow-left w-4 h-4","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","1l729n",{"d":"m12 19-7-7 7-7"}],["$","path","x3x0zl",{"d":"M19 12H5"}],"$undefined"]}],"All Recipes"],"data-slot":"button","data-variant":"ghost","data-size":"sm","className":"inline-flex items-center justify-center whitespace-nowrap text-sm font-medium transition-all disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50 [&_svg]:pointer-events-none [&_svg:not([class*='size-'])]:size-4 shrink-0 [&_svg]:shrink-0 outline-none focus-visible:border-ring focus-visible:ring-ring/50 focus-visible:ring-[3px] aria-invalid:ring-destructive/20 dark:aria-invalid:ring-destructive/40 aria-invalid:border-destructive hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground dark:hover:bg-accent/50 h-8 rounded-md px-3 has-[>svg]:px-2.5 gap-2","ref":null}]}]}]}]

20:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","id":"history","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold flex items-center gap-2 text-xl","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-history w-5 h-5 text-orange-600","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","1357e3",{"d":"M3 12a9 9 0 1 0 9-9 9.75 9.75 0 0 0-6.74 2.74L3 8"}],["$","path","1xhq8a",{"d":"M3 3v5h5"}],["$","path","1fdv2h",{"d":"M12 7v5l4 2"}],"$undefined"]}],"The Story Behind the Dish"]}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed","children":"Alfajores descended from the Arab al-qaq, brought to Spain during the Moorish occupation. Spanish colonists brought them to the Americas, where they evolved into the cornstarch-based version we know today. The Argentine alfajor de maicena is distinctively soft and crumbly, filled with dulce de leche (itself an Argentine invention). Today, alfajores are a national obsession, with brands like Havanna and Cachafaz achieving cult status."}]}]]}]
21:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6 pb-3","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold text-lg","children":"Storage & Leftovers"}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-0","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Store in airtight container at room temperature for 5 days, or refrigerated for 2 weeks. Bring to room temperature before serving. Unfilled cookies freeze well for 3 months."}]}]]}]
